properties.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 8 at 4:16AM AKST until February 8 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage, AK
properties.description:
* LOCATION...Bristol Bay coast.

* WAVES AND SURF...Expect high surf around and near high tide on
Saturday. Waves over open waters of Bristol Bay will reach 10
to 17 ft Saturday afternoon. With south winds of 50 kts over
the bay, these waves will build and move toward the northern
coast of Bristol Bay.

* SEA ICE...Strong winds and waves will push sea ice northward
and onshore, primarily along the northern coastline of Bristol
Bay.

* TIMING...9 am to 6 pm Saturday, with the highest water levels
around time of high tide. High tide will occur during the
early afternoon hours for most of the Bristol Bay coast.

* IMPACTS...High surf and wave action and coastal erosion are
possible. Sea ice may be pushed onshore.
properties.instruction:
A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in
the advisory area, producing localized beach erosion. Coastal
residents should be alert for rising water levels and take action
to protect property along the immediate coastline.

NWSheadline: HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING ALONG THE BRISTOL BAY COAST
